headline: An organization for keeping incompetence
status:
26 March 2014
"An organization for keeping incompetence"
1.0
★★★★★
Former Employee
pros:
Pseudo-retirement environment:
- Infinite money from goverment.
- No need to meet deadline.
- No need to monitor quality of work.
- It's OK even if a project fails. (somehow you get praised because you fail......)
- A normal experienced engineer only need to work less than 10% of time a day.
- Incompetent staffs can stay
- Guaranteed yearly raise higher than inflation.
- Can work till retire
cons:
Doomed job:
- 2nd hand technology, which the market does not need.
- Competent staffs are kicked away, so-called "spin off".
- Competence level keeps going down after 2 years of stay.
- No one can manage discipline of staffs
- Most employees cannot re-enter the job market because of high salary and incompetence.
- Once you leave ASTRI, you can really retire, because you can't find an R&D job in HK any more.
advice_to_mgmt:
This is really a miserable job for those who really contribute to the productive flow:
- There is no clear target.
- There is no regular team meeting so staffs don't know how their procrastinations affect the others.
- Managements are so inexperienced that they don't really care about the staffs.

My suggestion: go back to industry and then you know what I mean.
